content.description:
The Capture of Namur, engraving by an unknown artist, 1692Tallandier/Bridgeman Images

The engraving shows the French army’s siege and capture of the town of Namur, in the Spanish Netherlands, from Spanish and Dutch forces during the Nine Years’ War. Louis XIV is shown in the center, surrounded by his son and various members of the nobility.
content.question: Military operations such as the one shown in the engraving were most strongly supported by which of the following features of Louis XIV’s government?

choices.label: The establishment of a state monopoly on trade with the settlements of New France in North America
The creation of a strong centralized system of taxation and state finance
The opening of the senior officer ranks to middle-class men of proven talent and loyalty
The encouragement of agricultural improvements to increase the food supply

content.answer: The creation of a strong centralized system of taxation and state finance

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
